clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Anesthesia on Immunity in Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Immunomodulatory Effects of Volatile and Total Intravenous Anesthesia for Patients With Renal Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Meshalkin Research Institute of Pathology of Circulation

clinical_study.source: Meshalkin Research Institute of Pathology of Circulation

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is a comparative study of the cellular immunity response of patients operated on for kidney cancer under total intravenous and inhalational anesthesia.

detailed_description.textblock: The severity of perioperative immunosuppression is directly proportional to the degree of surgical stress. A series of experimental and clinical studies indicate a different effect of certain types of anesthesia on immunity. It is believed that surgical stress itself opens an opportunity for the recurrence of oncological diseases precisely due to the immunosuppressive effect. The aim of present pilot clinical study is to test a hypothesis that total intravenous anesthesia as superior to inhalational anesthesia in term of its effects on cell immunity among patients with kidney cancer.

primary_outcome.description: NK cells expression of CD16 receptor

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of surgery, postoperative days 1, 3-4, 7
secondary_outcome.description: CD45 expression on lymphocytes measured with flow cytometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of surgery, postoperative days 1, 3-4, 7

secondary_outcome.description: CD19 expression on lymphocytes measured with flow cytometry

secondary_outcome.description: CD4 expression on lymphocytes measured with flow cytometry

secondary_outcome.description: CD8 expression on lymphocytes measured with flow cytometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of surgery, postoperative days 1, 3-4, 7
secondary_outcome.description: CD16 expression on lymphocytes measured with flow cytometry

secondary_outcome.description: HLA-DR expression on lymphocytes measured with flow cytometry

arm_group.description: Patients, scheduled for nephrectomy for kidney cancer will receive neuraxial epidural block and propofol for perioperative anesthesia
Patients, scheduled for nephrectomy for kidney cancer will receive neuraxial epidural block and sevoflurane for perioperative anesthesia

intervention.description: Propofol will be used for anesthesia during surgery
Sevoflurane will be used for anesthesia during surgery
Epidural catheterization Th9-Th10, ropivacaine for perioperative analgesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Surgery for renal cancer
- Signed informed concent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Propofol or sevoflurane intolerance
- Contraindications for epidural anesthesia
- Renal failure
- Hepatic failure
- Congestive heart failure
- Previous hemotherapy
- Hematological diseases

facility.name: State Research Institute of Circulation Pathology

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Meshalkin Research Institute of Pathology of Circulation
